name: Fractured Seuss Books Quiz | Fractured Books | 25 Questions

questions.text: Bar solemn ewe windy you black
questions.correct: Bartholomew and the Oobleck
questions.explanation:
Bartholomew and the Oobleck.

	The awful oobleck was plumping down as big as greenish footballs now!

questions.correct: If I Ran the Circus
questions.explanation:
If I Ran the Circus.

	The Circus McGirkus!

questions.correct: How the Grinch Stole Christmas & How the Grinch Stole Christmas!
questions.explanation:
How the Grinch Stole Christmas & How the Grinch Stole Christmas!.

	The Grinch had been caught by this tiny Who daughter who'd got out of bed for a cup of cold water.

questions.text: Hippie birdy tatoo (By the way, throughout the quiz punctuation is optional--except apostrophes!)
questions.correct: Happy Birthday to You! & Happy Birthday to You
questions.explanation:
Happy Birthday to You! & Happy Birthday to You.

	You might be a doorknob! Or three baked potatoes! You might be a bag full of hard green tomatoes.

questions.correct: One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish & One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish
questions.explanation:
One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish & One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish.

	Say, what a lot of fish there are!

questions.correct: McElligot's Pool & Mc Elligot's Pool & McElligots Pool & Mc Elligots Pool
questions.explanation:
McElligot's Pool & Mc Elligot's Pool & McElligots Pool & Mc Elligots Pool.

	From down in the mire and the muck and the murk, I might catch some fish that are all going 'GLURK!'

questions.correct: Horton Hears a Who
questions.explanation:
Horton Hears a Who.

	A person's a person no matter how small!

questions.correct: The Sneetches and Other Stories
questions.explanation:
The Sneetches and Other Stories.

	When the Star-Belly Sneetches had frankfurter roasts or picnics or parties or marshmallow toasts, they never invited the Plain-Belly Sneetches. They left them out cold, in the dark of the beaches.

questions.text: Defies under rats supper solo mew cabins
questions.correct: The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins & The Five Hundred Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins
questions.explanation:
The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins & The Five Hundred Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins.

	'Did I or did I not command you to take off your hat?'

questions.text: Ahead rubble spaghetti to solace salute
questions.correct: I Had Trouble in Getting to Solla Sollew
questions.explanation:
I Had Trouble in Getting to Solla Sollew.

	There I was! With more Poozers than I'd ever seen! There I was! With my shooter and only one bean!

questions.text: End a thing that Esau it on mole bury sleet
questions.correct: And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street
questions.explanation:
And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street.

	And that is a story that no one can beat, when I say that I saw it on Mulberry Street.

questions.correct: Thidwick, the Big-Hearted Moose & Thidwick the Big-Hearted Moose & Thidwick the Big Hearted Moose & Thidwick, the Big Hearted Moose
questions.explanation:
Thidwick, the Big-Hearted Moose & Thidwick the Big-Hearted Moose & Thidwick the Big Hearted Moose & Thidwick, the Big Hearted Moose.

	'This big-hearted moose runs a public hotel! Bring your nuts! Bring your wife! Bring your children as well!'

questions.text: Oregon scratches Diego (drop the final 'o' sound)
questions.correct: Horton Hatches the Egg
questions.explanation:
Horton Hatches the Egg.

	When Mayzie bird grows bored with life on the nest, she fast-talks huge but gentle Horton the elephant into taking over her incubation duties in this Dr. Seuss classic. Standing (well, sitting) firm against foul weather, hecklers, and hunters, Horton is a true hero. A poignant, funny read-aloud in which integrity and nurturing are rewarded.

questions.correct: The Cat in the Hat
questions.explanation:
The Cat in the Hat.

	Two children are moping indoors on a rainy day when in strolls the Cat in the Hat. Making one of the most unforgettable entrances in the history of children's literature, the lanky feline, stylishly dressed in a candy-striped stovepipe hat and oversized bow tie, creates a whirlwind of misbehavior that the kids are at first powerless to halt.

questions.correct: The Lorax
questions.explanation:
The Lorax.

	When his beloved Truffula Trees are hacked down to make Thneeds (which everyone needs--supposedly), the mustachioed little Lorax protests angrily. Unfortunately, the potato-shaped crusader's gripes are in vain.

questions.correct: Oh, the Places You'll Go! & Oh the Places You'll Go & Oh, the Places You'll Go!
questions.explanation:
Oh, the Places You'll Go! & Oh the Places You'll Go & Oh, the Places You'll Go!.

	On you will go though the Hakken-Kraks howl. Onward up many a frightening creek, though your arms may get sore and your sneakers may leak.

questions.correct: Scrambled Eggs Super! & Scrambled Eggs Super & Scrambled Egg Super! & Scrambled Egg Super
questions.explanation:
Scrambled Eggs Super! & Scrambled Eggs Super & Scrambled Egg Super! & Scrambled Egg Super.

	Wacky Seussian birds roost in every imaginable nook and cranny.

questions.correct: Green Eggs and Ham
questions.explanation:
Green Eggs and Ham.

	The unquenchable Sam-I-am drags poor Mr. Negativity over hill, dale, and precarious aerial train track (with a cheerful mouse, fox, and goat in tow) until the hapless green-eggs-and-ham-hater consents to try the despised green breakfast.

questions.correct: The King's Stilts
questions.explanation:
The King's Stilts.

	One of Dr. Seuss's early, unrhymed books: 'Through the roof he could hear the noise of the Nizzards. Their beaks were as hard as iron and scratched through the air.'

questions.correct: Fox in Socks
questions.explanation:
Fox in Socks.

	When beetles battle beetles in a puddle paddle battle and the beetle battle puddle is a puddle in a bottle...they call this a tweetle beetle bottle puddle paddle battle muddle.

questions.correct: Hop on Pop
questions.explanation:
Hop on Pop.

	STOP You must not hop on Pop.

questions.correct: If I Ran the Zoo
questions.explanation:
If I Ran the Zoo.

	Narrated by young Gerald McGrew.

questions.correct: The Butter Battle Book & Butter Battle Book
questions.explanation:
The Butter Battle Book & Butter Battle Book.

	Seuss's funny, wise fable about the nuclear arms race. We ought to reread it, I believe.

questions.correct: I Can Lick 30 Tigers Today! & I Can Lick Thirty Tigers Today & I Can Lick Thirty Tigers Today! & I Can Lick 30 Tigers Today
questions.explanation:
I Can Lick 30 Tigers Today! & I Can Lick Thirty Tigers Today & I Can Lick Thirty Tigers Today! & I Can Lick 30 Tigers Today.

	A boastful book.

questions.text: Monster brawn canoe! Kazoo? (You can still leave out the punctuation, however.)
